It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as under the canopy of tropical forests. Its leaves are often lobed and have a leathery texture, which helps it retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a delicate and endangered species.
